question: Which of the following is/are NOT native or built-in data types in Python?
Mutable data types/collections in Python can be changed in place. Immutable ones can not change in place. Which of the following are mutable?
Which of the following is NOT true about Python?
answers: Base Python automatically parallelizes processing across cores when multiple cores are available

question: Which of the following pairs of events are mutually exclusive. There can be more than one answer.
answers: Negative numbers and positive numbers less than 25

question: Which types of programming tasks best describes what you are expected to already have some familiarity with before beginning this course?
answers: numeric computing, data munging, data visualization and data modeling

question: Though the emphasis may change, which two elements are both essential and common to all three process models we talked about?
answers: resolve the business question, feedback loops

question: Is the following statement True/False? To succeed in this course you are expected to be proficient in any one of the following: R, Python or Java.
Which of the following is the least accurate statement about the advantages of using process models in data science? Process models generally help by...
answers: speeding up the process of getting through the workflow

question: Is the following statement True/False? Design thinking is applied in other domains which helps make the task of communicating the AI workflow to those outside of data science easier.

Lets imagine there is a start-up that has a speech-to-text service that incorporates gestures and body language into its output. Which of the following products represents the most defensible business opportunity.
answers: Create a service that improves on existing audio recognition systems as a richer interface to mobile devices

question: Lets imagine there is a start-up that has a speech-to-text service that incorporates gestures and body language into its output. They offer annotated meeting reports as a product and customers are generally very satisfied, but sales to new customers tend to be very slow to acquire. Which of the following business opportunities should be the highest priority?
answers: Use customer segmentation and/or market analysis to help marketing with new customers

question: Your company is convinced it is time to change the nature of your companies core product and management has come to ask your advise. Which question DOES NOT exemplify scientific thinking in this situation?
answers: Which members of leadership support this decision?

question: Is the following statement true or false? CSV files are one of the most commonly used file formats for data science because file input/output is easy they are plain-text, and they work well with commonly used spreadsheet tools.

answers: word counts, user-item matrix for recommendations

question: Is the following statement True or False? Sparse matrices from SciPy need to be transformed into a dense matrix before using scikit-learns train-test-split function?

answers: Implement several checks for quality assurance

question: Which of the following is the least valid statement when it comes to dashboards?
answers: D. Dashboards are quick way to create portable simple plots

question: A data scientist at Company Z sorted the survey responses by whether the respondents used Product 1 or Product 2 and then compiled their ages: 1 2 3 4 5 p1_ages = [25., 32., 20., 18., 28., 32., 31., 19., 34., 34., 23., 29., 17., 23., 25., 31., 32., 29., 29., 24., 22., 28., 26., 24., 23.] p2_ages = [20., 25., 27., 19., 22., 26., 24., 27., 24., 20., 25., 28., 18., 19., 23., 28., 19., 19., 19., 25., 29., 26., 23., 23., 22.] Of the hypothesis test discussed in these contents what one is the most appropriate for testing the following hypothesis? There is no age difference, on average, between the users of product 1 and the users of product 2

Suppose that on average 2.5% of visitors to your website sign up for your newsletter. In a recent week, 2701 visitors out of a total of 108879 signed up. Using a binomial distribution. What is the probability that number of visitors who signed up is 2701 or fewer?
True/False. If there customer churn were quantified using a Poisson distribution, then a bootstrap could be used to quantify the uncertainty associated with the estimate.
Which of the following is NOT and example of a valid strategy to deal with the multiple comparisons problem?
answers: C. Perform all comparisons then only keep the single test that performs the best

question: Which of the following is statements is the least correct in the context of the EDA process
answers: D. The EDA process can be used to help predict time to completion for a project

question: Which of the following is an example of a data manipulation that is NOT considered reproducible research?
answers: C. The use of proprietary tools to carry out research

question: True/False. The seaborn pairplot and other seaborn plotting functions exist as distinct tools from the plots available through matplotlib.

In the continuing AAVAIL streaming case study example, one of the data features that can be useful in answering questions about customer churn is the total number of streams that a customer has watched. Imagine that you are working with a dataset where 10% of customers are missing this feature. A good place to start would be to go back and see if it’s possible to gather this information from the user logs, but assuming that this initiative is unsuccessful, you will have to decide what to do about this missing data. Which course of action is LEAST likely to be helpful in modeling churn?
answers: A. Replace the missing stream count with the mean stream count among users where this information is available.

question: What is the main reason for using multiple imputation?
answers: C. Multiple imputation helps to better characterize the error introduced by replacing missing/unknown data with some chosen values.

question: Which of the following is NOT an example of assumption that you work with when making probability statements about a sample of data?
answers: E. That the probability statement applies to one observation at a time in a data set

question: There are many ways to carry out statistical inference. Which one method of the following is NOT used to compute estimates in the context of statistical inference.

Company Z sent out a user satisfaction survey to its customers that included some demographic questions. They want to determine if there is a difference in the age among users of Product 1 versus users of Product 2 (at least among the survey respondents). Which of the following is an appropriate null hypothesis for this study?
answers: C. Users of Product 1 and Product 2 are on average the same age.

question: It is day one on the job and you need to come up with a plan—how do you begin?
answers: Get the perspective from management and follow the leads they might provide

question: In order to come up with the back-of-the-envelope ROI calculation for this project, how might you approach it?
answers: D. Number of active users X Yearly payment - estimate for cost of project time

question: Thinking with the lens of the scientific process, what would your next steps be if you wanted to decide where to open the next store for your sled business?
answers: Gather different data say snowfall by county and repeat the experiment

question: When embarking on a data science project, why do you ultimately want to format your data so that it can be housed in something like a Pandas DataFrame or NumPy Array?
answers: Nearly all modeling algorithms take input data in a tabular format analogous to format of DataFrames/Arrays.

question: Which tasks should be included in a data ingestion pipeline? (Choose one or more)
answers: A. Account for missing data, faulty data, repeated observations and other data integrity issues
B. Ensure that expected data is returned given a specific set of parameters
C. Ensure that an expected format is returned

question: Sparse matrices can be useful as a target destination for ETL, but what are the main caveats (choose one or more)?

E. It is difficult to print to screen scipy.sparse matrices directly

question: Which of the following statements does not describe valid use case for dimensionality reduction?

answers: Because domain experts can visually inspect the validity of the topics

answers: Use recall as the evaluation metric

question: True/False. All classifiers in scikit-learn do multi-class classification out-of-the-box. These classifiers can differ in their approach though (e.g one-vs-all or one-vs-one).

question: Using the Café Sherlock example: How do you ensure new games drive revenue? Take the time to write down 2 ways you could validate the core business question into a testable hypothesis.
answers: Hypothesis 1: If a new game is introduced at Café Sherlock, then the average spend per customer will increase by at least 10% over a 4-week period. Hypothesis 2: If a new game is introduced at Café Sherlock, then customer visit frequency will increase by at least 15% over the following month.

question: If you were to munge the data into a pandas.DataFrame which of the following would describe a reasonable goal for the cleaning process?
answers: transactions on the rows and items like customer_name and item_id on the columns

question: Our model performed very well (see below), possibly because Dr. Holmes and Dr. Watson are described in very different ways in the stories, but it could be something else. 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 precision recall f1-score support sherlock 0.96 1.00 0.98 150 watson 1.00 0.83 0.91 36 accuracy 0.97 186 macro avg 0.98 0.92 0.94 186 weighted avg 0.97 0.97 0.97 186 These results are not directly related to revenue, but for the sake of the example let's assume you needed a decent version of this model to craft a new game. Take a minute to think about how you would interpret these results.
answers: The model performs very well overall, accurately identifying Sherlock with perfect recall and high precision. For Watson, it has perfect precision but lower recall, meaning it misses some Watson instances. This suggests the model is reliable but could improve on capturing all Watson examples to enhance balance and accuracy for game development.
